summary: This bill, the WWII Nurses Congressional Gold Medal Act, aims to award a Congressional Gold Medal to the women who served in the U.S. Army Nurse Corps and U.S. Navy Nurse Corps during World War II. The bill highlights their bravery and dedication, detailing their service in various theaters of the war, including under fire in field hospitals and prisoner of war camps. The medal will be given to the Smithsonian Institution for display and research, with duplicate bronze medals available for sale.
